subject: Marketing
title: Price Is a Feeling
description: A short lesson to help you apply Price Is a Feeling.

hook.text: Wine experts rated a $5 wine as excellent when told it cost $45. Same wine, new price tag.

buildup.text: Brain scans showed the pleasure center lit up more when subjects believed the wine cost more.

discovery.text: Price doesn't just reflect value‚Äîit actually changes how people experience value.

twist.text: The expensive wine tasted better because the brain made it taste better.

climax.text: Pricing is not a math problem. It's a psychology experiment on every customer.

punchline.text: Price changes perception, not just cost.

quiz.question: What happened when wine experts were told a $5 wine cost $45?
options: They rated it excellent and brain scans confirmed greater pleasure
They rated it lower than its actual quality
